||| MAFIABOT || Starting a game of Mafia in . Type "!xmafia in" to sign up. |||


After reading the topic you realize you should !xmafia help before ining for the game
-xylbot-Failing to follow these rules may result in being modkilled
-XylBot- If you have any questions, concerns or suggestions, please do not hesitate to make a request in bold and prefaced with !xmafia help ( DO IT THE MOD DEMANDS ! )
-XylBot- 1. You may not communicate privately with another player unless they are part of the same scum/mason group as you.
-XylBot- 2. You may not quote any messages you receive from Cojin privately. You may paraphrase if you want.
-XylBot- 3. If you feel the need to bah post you may once using this exact script "All hail Cojin"
-XylBot- 4. You must attempt to fulfill your win condition in all games.
-XylBot- 5. You may not bring outside information or vendettas into the current game. This does not include meta-plays or bot knowledge.
-XylBot- 6. Please do not join games you cannot complete. If you need to leave, say state that you need to be replaced
-XylBot- 7. Do not abuse Cojin lag or bugged Cojin mechanics.
-XylBot- 8. Do not spam the channel or use excessive caps. For long pastes, consider the eyes of other players
-XylBot- 9. Undetectable fakevotes must not be used.
-Xylbot- 10. Talking is permitted tell the thread locks unvotes or votes will not be counted after a hammer
-Xylbot- 11. You're not allowed to edit your posts.
-Xyblot- 12. Votes must be in bold and should look like this !vote name Unvotes are not necessarily
-Xylbot- 13. Deadlines are 2 weeks for a day and night is 48 hours
-Xylbot- 14. You may talk after the hammer but any votes will not be counted

Vanilla role
Townie (town). You win when all the bad guys are gone, and there is at least one town aligned player alive



A list of roles that can be in the setup and the format they are in can be found here viewtopic.php?f=5&t=12368&start=0 Keep in mind only roles that are considered normal will be included

Hello everyone!

I'd like to ask everyone a few questions just know of everyone's experience and philosophy. Now this isn't required, but I'd appreciate it and it'll help me read you earlier.
1 - Experience - What is your prior experience with Mafia? How many games have you played at Mafiascum? How many games have you played elsewhere?
2 - Philosophy - If you were a cop and got a guilty on night one, would you out the guilty that day(not knowing if there is any protection of course) or would you try to get the other scum before outing?


I'll give my philosophy after I see some of yours.

vote smear

found one.

b) I've played around fourty games on mafiascum.
c) Other than on mafiascum and real-life? None.
2. I'd try to get my guilty lynched without actually claiming. Usually this would involve building a case.

2) out 'em. In a mini normal like this your chance of getting two guiltys is less than your chance of getting nked or lynched. Always out your guiltys in a game with so few people.

vote: smear. thar be weird posting thar.

1. I've read quite a few games on and off-site, but this is only my second game.

2. 1-for-1 trades are always good for town, but I'd still have to think about it. It's possible that I wouldn't be a likely nightkill target unclaimed, in which case I'd hold my information, and there is always the possibility I scanned a miller. Still, I would probably claim nine times out of ten, but not without seeing whether I could get a lynch without a claim first.

On the sudden Smear wagon: Don't like it. He seems confused about the flavor, which I sympathize with; it's probably some inside joke that I can't comprehend. And everything else he's posted is typical RVS stuff. Unvote; vote Subcomfreak for jumping onto such a flimsy lynch so suddenly.

I'd like to ask everyone a few questions just know of everyone's experience and philosophy. Now this isn't required, but I'd appreciate it and it'll help me read you earlier.

I'll give my philosophy after I see some of yours.


1: I have participated in a total of 18 games on-site, including replacement games and games I played as a hydra. I don't have any off-site experience worth mentioning.
2: Out right at the start. You've got confirmed scum, and it's very rare for a cop to catch more than one scum. Catching one scum is actually already above average.

Also, Nikanor and Smear are town. Nikanor was the first to confirm and goofed around in the confirmation stage a lot. Scum don't goof around in the game thread in confirmation stage; they goof around in the scumtalk thread. Smear's questions come from a town perspective.

The wagon on Smear is weak, but it's just as likely town getting a bandwagon going as it is scum pushing a weak wagon. However, I don't like Lowell's vote:

[quote="vote smear

found one.[/quote]

vote: Lowell

found one.

Also, have you played with Lowell before?

Aaaaaalso
If there is a miller in this game, he should claim now please.

Alright, my answers:
1. I've completed 4 games here at Mafiascum. Prior to that I played a lot at EpicMafia, and prior to that, the game was taught at a summer camp I worked at.
2. I'd out it. I wouldn't want to take the risk of me dying. the guilty is far too important.

I agree with miller claiming, it'll prevent mafia from doing it later.

I have played with Lowell and am familiar with his meta. However, I still want to know what he meant by that vote.

I think that the early-game miller claim is debatable. But while I'd generally support the claim itself, I am against the idea of actively calling for it. Asking the miller to claim is basically an invitation for scum to safely claim it and coast through the whole game. I'd much rather see either scum or town claim miller of their own volition, and let us figure things out from there.

Brothers Yamazaki wrote:I think that the early-game miller claim is debatable. But while I'd generally support the claim itself, I am against the idea of actively calling for it. Asking the miller to claim is basically an invitation for scum to safely claim it and coast through the whole game. I'd much rather see either scum or town claim miller of their own volition, and let us figure things out from there.

Millers should claim first post, period. It would be anti town not to. Lets say the cop investigates at random. He has a 3/12 (most of the time) chance of hitting scum. If the miller does not claim right away and he randomly hits him out of the 1/12 the cop would out and we would mis-lynch. And then the cop could possibly die during the night. Further more it lets him eliminate someone from his investigate list, bringing it to a 3/11.

Also, no sane scum would claim miller. Because of the nature of the role we will at one point have to make a decision to lynch or not to lynch the miller. The scum (as a whole) really have little to no control over that decision. It all depends if that one individual player can look town... And who can predict what will happen 20 pages down the line? And not to mention that claiming P-1 without seeing any other claims is very very risky in itself for scum.

Put simply, its not a good idea for scum to claim early, too much trouble and way too many things could go wrong.
But wouldn't claiming miller also help mafia find PR?

Indirectly, yes. However, if we do have a miller it is indicative of a cop. And personally I think having a cop go with a chance of 3/11 beats 3/12 with the chance of a fake guilty. Yes it helps the scum find a power role, but having the miller out right now would prevent a lot of wifom and mislynches.

Subcomfreak wrote:
Brothers Yamazaki wrote:I think that the early-game miller claim is debatable. But while I'd generally support the claim itself, I am against the idea of actively calling for it. Asking the miller to claim is basically an invitation for scum to safely claim it and coast through the whole game. I'd much rather see either scum or town claim miller of their own volition, and let us figure things out from there.

Further more it lets him eliminate someone from his investigate list, bringing it to a 3/11.


I do understand the logic behind the miller claiming as early as possible. But I think that there's a valid argument for the alternative, and I just don't believe in forcing a hypothetical miller to claim immediately on Day 1.

Subcomfreak wrote:Also, no sane scum would claim miller. Because of the nature of the role we will at one point have to make a decision to lynch or not to lynch the miller. The scum (as a whole) really have little to no control over that decision. It all depends if that one individual player can look town... And who can predict what will happen 20 pages down the line? And not to mention that claiming P-1 without seeing any other claims is very very risky in itself for scum.

Put simply, its not a good idea for scum to claim early, too much trouble and way too many things could go wrong.


Scum can claim whenever they want, if it makes them seem more pro-town. A good enough scum could convince people that there's really two millers in a game, if a counterclaim happens (though it's easier to do in flavor games, I suppose).

The thing is, I don't deny that a Post 1 miller claim is probably the best way to play the role. The problem is, when someone specifically asks for it, it feels like scum trying to out a miller early, to either track down power roles or see if it's safe for one of them to claim. And for that reason, I'll Unvote; and Vote: Nikanor.

@BBMolla
Your questions. My meta is in my wiki and I can link to more recent ones but I played 40+ games on site and on IRC, and Skype with the crew here. Also for the cop I'd attempt to lynch with a case and strongly hint/bread crumb my result. However, depending on the feel of the town, and if I feel that we're on the wrong track/or I just feel that it's the most advantageous to claim rightout (say we're down a few mislynches, or I totally disagree with the current wagons, etc) then I will claim. It depends on the feel and I adapt to the situation. I'd claim/not claim when it's most advantageous.

Problems though with this post: I'd don't mind but these two questions are smokescreen questions especially since it's about meta. I'm not impressed by the fact that you didn't ask people for references to their games. Nor am I impressed that you chose to withhold your viewpoints until after you can read everyones. These questions don't launch people into discussion on the players, they focus on theory talk that distracts us from actual scum hunting/game play. That belongs to MD. So I'm not impressed by your fancy questions since I see no purpose in how you can use the information to read the players when you can't verify the player's self meta via links. My bullet will be reserved for you tomorrow.

EBWOP: a. Sorry I should clarify. It doesn't out the setup if a miller claims. However a miller claim day 1 makes me keep an eye on the person but if I get a town read I'm more likely to don't recant on it. Just for obvious reasons of the miller claim and such. But optimal play says miller should claim day 1. There's no advantage to claiming it past that since the element of WIFOM increases significantly. I'd rather have the time to deal with it now then later.

ALso as a note, I find myself agreeing with Nikanor about Bub since I was about to ask him the same question. I find it odd that Bub singled out Lowell the first vote on the supposed "Smear wagon" out of all the votes that he can't hold an alignment read on. It registers on my radar since it's kind of an odd attack. But I can't tell if it's due to the start game (since we have little to start with of course) or is this just someone grasping for straws. And even if it's the latter the lack of info allows the grasping for straws to be validated since the game just started. That's just me.

Bub Bidderskins: Scum. One of the things that many have praised as a townie action, making cases for people being town, is one of the things that has me the most worried about him. DTMaster: Null. Needs a replacement, since he hasn't posted in over 2 weeks. His posts are mostly incomprehensible and barely worth my time to read.

Frogsterking: Scum. Post #45 makes no sense to me as a case. Guy_Named_Riggs: Scum-lean. Lobstermania: Null. Man, there are a lot of inactive people in this game.

Lowell: Null. There needs to be more elaborations from him. Never found out why he voted Bub in Post #51 and I can't really tell where his head is at right now.

Smear: Scum-lean. What can I say that hasn't already been said by benoni? Mot much.

Subcomfreak: Town. The main reason aside from just generally good posting is his vote and continued pressure on Bub. And by setting up the theory that is Smear is town, benoni is scum and vice versa, he can jump on the wagon tomorrow should one be lynched today.

As I hope you can all see, many of these town proclamations are half-cocked and far stronger than they have any right to be. And I use the word 'proclamation' rather than 'read' because a read implies certain things. For starters, it's typically backed up by some legitimate reasoning. And the reads aren't made with such force. It's not particularly in the town's best interest to speak in such absolutes over such paltry reasons.

What's more, proclaiming other players as town is not an inherently town action. There's plenty of trust to be gained by calling people town rather than calling them scum. It's a great way to manipulate people and get them to trust you. You know you are town and having someone out there who has your back feels comforting, but it just luls you into a false sense of security. Buddying is dangerous.

From a scum perspective, it's good to get at least one buddy some towncred too and the fact that he's naming so many people town means that we can't possibly determine who is one of his buddies in there.

Regarding Smear: There's no reason to make it a public target. Doing so is just more likely to get us screwed. There are many more bad scenario's if we get him to make a public shot rather than a private shot. Public decisions are better for things like Doctor or Jailkeeper. Aggressive roles like Cop or Vig can be sabotaged more easily if the target is known. They could kill and roleblock him if it's scum he is targeting or they could take it that direction even if it is town so that we think it's scum. They could kill the same person. It's arguably a waste of a kill, but when only one kill goes through, we are less inclined to trust him and so he can be mislynched more easily. They could simply roleblock him and keep him alive and kill someone else, though admittedly, they could do so even if his target isn't public. By leaving it on him to decide, we cut down scum responsiveness, which is a plus. And he shouldn't claim his number of shots either. If he has less shots, it makes him less of a threat and he'll be less likely to be targeted when it would be better if he was and if he has no limit, it will make him a higher priority when he shouldn't be. One shot also means that they can let him shoot once without them shooting and from then on they can kill while he looks bad or vice cersa, he can be scum hiding behind the fact that he can't shoot anymore.

[quote=Wiki] Closed Normal Games should satisfy the following rules:
The game should have at least one Mafia or Werewolf group (of at least two members). A second anti-town group can be given a separate Mafia family name, or can be a Werewolf group. There should be no more than two mafia/werewolf factions, and no more than one Serial Killer.
The game must contain at least one Vanilla Townie (allowed names include: Townie, Vanilla Townie, Innocent Townsperson, Citizen). A sample Role PM for the Vanilla Townie must be included in the rules post.
Mechanics which are explicitly Non-Normal include:
Those affecting a role's alignment (no Cults).
Anything which significantly affects the core mechanic of majority/plurality lynches (no Kingmaker, for example).
Anything resolving with a random element, with the exception of missed night choices. It must be included in the public ruleset if you are resolving night choices in this way.
Post Restrictions (other than those included in the ruleset, such as "No quoting your Role PM").
Lying to the players, including False Role Reveals and "Scum Masons".
Night action redirection (no Bus Driver, Lightning Rod, Nexus, or Redirector).
Alignments other than Mafia/Werewolf, Pro-Town, and Serial Killer (no Survivor, Lyncher, or Jester).
Roles which are explicitly Normal include:
Vanilla Townie, Sane Cop, Doctor, Vigilante, Roleblocker, Mason, Innocent Child, Jailkeeper, Tracker, Watcher, Gunsmith, Miller, Bodyguard, Role Cop, Doublevoter, Hider, Neighbor, Neighborizer, Jack of All Trades, Serial Killer, Mafia Goon, Mafia Traitor, Mafia Godfather, Mafia Framer, Mafia-aligned versions of above roles
Modifiers which are explicitly Normal include:
Even/Odd Night, Non-Consecutive Night, X-Shot, Bulletproof, Neighbor, Compulsive, Macho, Weak, Backup (with or without primary role present)
Roles which are explicitly Non-Normal include:
Non-Sane Cop, Blank Vig, Non-Sane or Quack Doctor, Janitor, Survivor, Lyncher, Cultist, Jester, Mafia Mason, Bus Driver, Lightning Rod, Nexus, Redirector.
Modifiers which are explicitly Non-Normal include:
N/A
Normal Games may use any amount of approved roles (so long as there is at least one Vanilla Townie) in conjunction with approved modifiers.
New/variant roles may be included in limited number (no more than 1 in a Mini, 2 in a Large), and should be based on the usual role mechanics: Killing, Protecting, Investigating, Blocking, Voting, Enabling and Communication.
Games which are otherwise Normal may still be more suited to a different Queue. For example, a game with a large number of Doctors may be better run as an Open Game (after review in the Open Discussion Thread) or as a "Hospital" Themed Game.
Prior to running, all Normal Games are subject to a mandatory review for normalcy and balance by the Normal Game Review Group. To learn more about this process, visit this page.

Frogsterking: Town-lean. Sad to say I think I was wrong about this guy, but on the reread, there were a couple of things that really stuck out to me. RandomActs/Lobstermania: Null-scum. Smear: Town-lean. I believe his claim and I have a theory about last night. I hadn't even considered the Doctor when this Day began for some reason. It makes more sense to me than scum deciding that Lowell was a bigger threat than either claimed PR.
